Three Channel PI Control¶

  • @file three_channel_PI_control.py

  • @author CU Boulder Medtronic Team 7

  • @brief Basic 2D proportional and/or PID controller

    used for 3 channel robots

class three_channel_PI_control.GUI(master)[source]¶

Class for building GUI

GUI_handleDataDisplay(*args)[source]¶

Display control algorithm parameters to the GUI. When the GUI is open, you can press and hold enter to display all the values

GUI_handleLoggingCommand(status)[source]¶

This function handles starting of the logging. Starting the logging sequence also starts running a predefined trajectory like a circle. You can uncomment the circle_signal call if you want to record data while still maintaining manual control

GUI_handleSetKdCommand(*args)[source]¶

Handle setting the gain from the GUI

GUI_handleSetKiCommand(*args)[source]¶

Handle setting the gain from the GUI

Handle setting the gain from the GUI

Handle setting the position from the GUI

GUI_handlesetZPositionCommand(*args)[source]¶

Handle setting the position from the GUI

class three_channel_PI_control.command(id, field1, field2)[source]¶

Basic command format to be used in the queue. We pass along id’s and any other important info in field1 and field2

class three_channel_PI_control.controllerThread(name)[source]¶

This thread is where the main controller is run. This is where our PID controller lives

circle_signal()[source]¶

Function will send position commands to follow a circle

fig_eight_signal()[source]¶

Function will try to send robot in a figure 8

forceVectorCalc()[source]¶

calculates the force vector solution for the controller given the error vector and the unit vectors of each channel

get_id()[source]¶

returns id of the respective thread

handleGUICommand(newCmd)[source]¶

Function to handle commands from the GUI. Takes place on controller thread

raise_exception()[source]¶

raise exception for controller thread

run()[source]¶

Infinite loop for controller until turned off. Continues to look for new commands from the GUI and runs the three channel main.

sendDesiredPressure()[source]¶

convert P_des and send this pressure into the Arduino

three_channel_algorithm()[source]¶

Proportional/PID feedback loop algorithm (vector based solution – includes dot product and bounded least squares solution)

three_channel_main()[source]¶

main function used in thread to perform 3 channel algorithm

three_channel_PI_control.main()[source]¶

Starting point for script

three_channel_PI_control.max_pressure = array([16, 16, 16])¶

These gain values have been tuned for the 2x robots that we were made. It can vary for all the different robots, especially the max pressure. Last value is bound for int sum. This is where we reset the integral term to 0 to avoid windup

three_channel_PI_control.time_diff = 0¶

These gain values have been tuned for the 2x robots that we were made. It can vary for all the different robots, especially the max pressure. Last value is bound for int sum. This is where we reset the integral term to 0 to avoid windup

Three Channel Open Control¶

  • @file three_channel_open_control.py

  • @author CU Boulder Medtronic Team 7

  • @brief This script allows for open loop control of

    a 3 channel robot (i.e manually controlling pressures)

Open Channel Open Control¶

  • @file basic_GUI_Implementation.py

  • @author CU Boulder Medtronic Team 7

  • @brief Integrates Arduino with EM sensor in one python script.

    Provides GUI with simple commands like read pressure, write pressure, and read position for one channel robots only

Handling Arduino related commands from GUI
